overview: New Delhi is the British‑built capital of India, characterised by wide boulevards, roundabouts, colonial mansions and government buildings. It hosts major shopping areas such as Connaught Place and Khan Market, and the nearby Paharganj district offers many inexpensive hotels. The city forms part of the larger National Capital Territory of Delhi, a major centre of arts, commerce, education and tourism.
bestTimeToVisit: October to March (cooler, more pleasant weather)
idealDuration: 3–4 days to cover the main sights and markets
approximateDailyBudgetINR: ≈ 2,000 INR per day for budget accommodation, meals and transport
travelTips: Use the Delhi Metro for cheap and reliable transport.
Stay in budget hotels in Paharganj for affordable rates.
Carry bottled water and eat at reputable eateries.
Avoid peak traffic hours (7‑10 am, 5‑8 pm).
Keep valuables secure and be aware of pickpockets in crowded areas.
